subject: Re: [junit] fundamental questions on JUnit
msgSnippet: I shall try to explain more clearly: if(some condition is true) { do some work; return result1; } else { do some other work; return result2; } Here are two
messageBody:
I shall try to explain more clearly:

if(some condition is true) {
do some work;
return result1;
}
else {
do some other work;
return result2;
}

Here are two execution paths within a procedure. Both
result1 and result2 might be identical in value some
of the time, for a many to one function. Using Junit,
how can one know that both paths have been exercised
or tested?

> the basic question for me in the discussion is:
>
> 2) <b> How can you verify the execution path that a
> program is taking unless its output returned is
> unique
> for that path? </b>
>
